intro: Gentianella calcis, commonly known as the limestone gentian, is a flowering plant native to calcareous grasslands and rocky soils in Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which is characterized by showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
